meanings.sent1: She jabbed the straw into her juice box.
meanings.sent2: The doctor jabbed the needle into my arm for the vaccine.
meanings.sent3: He jabbed his finger into the cake to sneak a taste.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches jabbed at the sky like sharp fingers.
meanings.sent5: The boxer jabbed at his opponent with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: To prod or poke with a sharp object
meanings.sent1: The tailor jabbed the needle through the fabric.
meanings.sent2: She jabbed the fork into the ripe strawberry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten jabbed at the dangling thread.
meanings.sent4: The icy wind jabbed at my skin like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: He jabbed the pencil into the paper to make a point.

meanings.definition: To make a quick, sharp movement
meanings.sent1: The lizard jabbed its tongue out to catch a fly.
meanings.sent2: She jabbed her elbow into my side to get my attention.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jabbed at the audience with witty remarks.
meanings.sent4: The lightning jabbed across the dark sky in a zigzag.
meanings.sent5: The dancer jabbed her foot forward in a sudden move.
